title: Drawing, Project for a Painted Octagonal Panel, 1826
title_raw: Project for a Painted Octagonal Panel
markings: With the stampe of the office.
inscribed:
Caption written in ink: "Gabinetto mobile. Soggetto Marte e Venere."

At left: "No. 9"

Written on back: "Composto No. 9 inventato da me sottoscritto/Marco Capizzucchi," and by another hand: "Rimini VI Gennaio 1826/vista e certificata la firma soprascritta/del Sige Capizzucchi Professore di disegno nel/nro comunale Ginnaio/Il Gonfaloniere, Av. Luigi Posci."

Written in the lower left corner, vertically: "No. 12"
description: Horizontal rectangle. Somewhat more than the lower half is executed. In the center is an octagon with Venus and Mars and two putti. It is framed by two strips. The main panel is decorated by oblongs standing upon the sides of the central octagon. Upon a laced background, candelabra are shown. Candelabra are also in the quadrangles in the intervals between the oblongs. Outside is a border with representations of playing children in octagons which are connected by groups of children upon dolphins, on a laced background.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Project for a Painted Octagonal Panel, 1826; Designed by Marco Capizzucchi ; Italy; pencil, opaque colors on paper; H x W: 38 × 39.5 cm (14 15/16 × 15 9/16 in.); 1940-21-20
